actions.text: Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.
Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 911.

official_title: To preserve the authority of the Supreme Court Police to provide protective services for Justices and court personnel.

summary.text: Makes permanent the authority of the Marshal of the Supreme Court and the Supreme Court Police to provide protective services for Supreme Court Justices, official guests of the Court, and Court personnel. (Such authority is scheduled to expire on December 26, 1986.)

titles.title: To preserve the authority of the Supreme Court Police to provide protective services for Justices and court personnel.
